Class Converter.NumToRoman

  • java.lang.Object
    • Converter.NumToRoman
  • Enclosing class:
    Converter
    class Converter.NumToRoman
extends java.lang.Object
    Number to Roman Numeral Logic. This class holds the logic that converts a inputted number into a roman numeral. It takes in the input for the getNum method in the Converterclass.

    • Method Detail

      • processNum

        protected java.lang.String processNum()
        Processes user input and outputs results. This method processes the user input by using the method and generates an output.
        Returns:
        the final roman numeral String

      • analyseNum

        private void analyseNum​(int length,
                        int index)
        Analyse user input and generate useful values for later calculations. This method analyses the integer input and generates multiple values used for calculations in the complexRoman method.
        Parameters:
        length - the total length of the number
        index - the current index of the length

      • basicRoman

        private void basicRoman​(int value)
        Basic roman numeral behaviour. This method checks the basic HashMap, and simply appends the respective value to the total.
        Parameters:
        value - the powerValue at the current index

      • complexRoman

        private void complexRoman​(int degreeValue,
                          int degree)
        More complex subtractive/additive behaviour. This method utilises many values from the analyseNum method. By using the roman numeral rules, the values are determined using a few conditional statements that hold reference to the degree of ten and how it relates to the 'basic' roman numerals.
        Parameters:
        degreeValue - the powerValue at the current index
        degree - the degree of 10 at current index
